title: Costs of external consequences of cyber attacks on businesses 2018
summary: This bar chart has 4 columns on the x axis representing Category, and Cost in million U.S. dollars in each Category on the y axis.
Category Information loss has the highest Cost in million U.S. dollars and Revenue loss has the lowest Cost in million U.S. dollars.
Category Information loss has 11.8 times more Cost in million U.S. dollars than Category Revenue loss which is has the lowest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Category in the x axis and Cost in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 4 columns on the x axis representing Category, and Cost in million U.S. dollars in each Category on the y axis.
Category Information loss has the highest Cost in million U.S. dollars and Revenue loss has the lowest Cost in million U.S. dollars.
Category Information loss has 11.8 times more Cost in million U.S. dollars than Category Revenue loss which is has the lowest.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Category in the x axis and Cost in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
The difference of Cost in million U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Category is 5.4.
Category Information loss is higher than any other Categorys with value 5.9, followed by Business disruption, and Equipment damages. Down to Category Revenue loss with the lowest value 0.5.
Considered together, the average Cost in million U.S. dollars in all 4 Categorys is roughly 3.25.
Summing up the values of all Categorys, we get total 13.0.
